means: 用胶水将物体粘合( glue的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The minute that the war started, everybody was glued to the television.
sentence.Network_cn: 战事一起，所有人都盯紧了电视报道。

sentence.Network_en: He kept his eyes glued to the clock.
sentence.Network_cn: 他目不转睛地盯着钟表。

entry.def: Glue is a sticky substance used for joining things together, often for repairing broken things.
If you glue one object to another, you stick them together using glue.

example.ex: Glue the fabric around the window...
example.tran: 用胶水把布料粘在窗户周围。

example.ex: The material is cut and glued in place...
example.tran: 材料被剪切下来并粘贴到合适位置。

entry.def: If you say that someone is glued to something, you mean that they are giving it all their attention.

example.ex: They are all glued to the Olympic Games.
example.tran: 他们都被奥运会吸引住了。

means.word_mean: 1. affixed or as if affixed with glue or paste;

auth_sentence.content: Not knowing what will happen keeps the audience glued.
auth_sentence.res_content: Not knowing what will happen keeps the audience glued.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Not knowing what will happen keeps the audience glued.

auth_sentence.content: Two girls glued pink feathers all along the hem.

auth_sentence.content: He patched the screens with little glued-on squares of screen.
auth_sentence.res_content: He patched the screens with little glued-on squares of screen.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He patched the screens with little glued-on squares of screen.
